title: Ticket #3870: Rescaling warnings in hgq_assign_quotas
description:
Seems to be a precision problem in hgq_assign_quotas with

double Zd = max(dqsum, double(1))

and

child->config_quota / Zd

where you see things like

rescaled from 0 to 0
rescaled from 0.00133333 to 0.00133333


==========================================
01/18/13 17:06:26 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group prod.boo.boo_char_td rescaled from 0.00133333 to 0.00133333
01/18/13 17:06:26 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group prod.boo.boo_crowd rescaled from 0 to 0
01/18/13 17:06:26 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group prod.boo.boo_cycles rescaled from 0 to 0
01/18/13 17:06:26 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group prod.boo.boo_flo rescaled from 0.00133333 to 0.00133333
01/18/13 17:06:26 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group prod.boo.boo_fx rescaled from 0.032 to 0.032
01/18/13 17:06:26 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group prod.boo.boo_hi rescaled from 0.9 to 0.9
==========================================
remarks:
2013-Aug-24 11:17:12 by eje:
TESTING 

NUM_CPUS = 10

GROUP_NAMES = a, b, c

# these add up to slightly > 1, so will trigger rescale warning pre-fix
GROUP_QUOTA_DYNAMIC_a = 0.33333334
GROUP_QUOTA_DYNAMIC_b = 0.33333334
GROUP_QUOTA_DYNAMIC_c = 0.33333334

If you spin up the negotiator with the above configuration, pre-fix you will see warning messages like this in NegotiatorLog, due to "numeric-jitter" rescaling: 

08/24/13 08:55:03 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group a rescaled from 0.333333 to 0.333333
08/24/13 08:55:03 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group b rescaled from 0.333333 to 0.333333
08/24/13 08:55:03 group quotas: WARNING: dynamic quota for group c rescaled from 0.333333 to 0.333333

After the fix, these will go away.

2013-Aug-26 11:35:59 by johnkn:
I don't understand why you didn't just change the code to read 

    if (Zd > 1.0001)

But I don't think this really fixes the fundamental problem. when you do 

    child->config_quota / Zd

where Zd is 1.00001, you can end up with a assigned quota value just slightly < 1, and we know that when a quota of just slightly < 1 is assigned, the job never gets ANY resources.

I think this warning is telling you about actual problems with the the quota assignment math, papering over the warning isn't really helpful.

2013-Aug-26 21:20:18 by eje:
Zd is the normalization factor for dynamic quotas, which are expected to sum to a value <= 1. When Zd is > 1, that is because the child quotas summed to > 1, and so it emits the warning prior to normalizing the values.

However, if Zd is only a very small amount larger, that's most likely due to numeric precision errors, and regardless the actual change to the quotas will be insignificant, so with this change the warning is skipped in that case.

This makes it easier to see more significant warnings. It also reduces time and space from log output for customers who reconfigure the negotiator very frequently and have very large accounting group configurations.

2013-Sep-13 11:42:28 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW: looks ok
